oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Neoclassical Pitch-Angle Scattering of Runaway Electrons
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Liu, Jian
Wang, Yulei
Qin, Hong
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Physics - Plasma Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: It is discovered that the tokamak field geometry generates a pitch-angle scattering effect for runaway electrons. This neoclassical pitch-angle scattering is much stronger than the collisional scattering and invalidates the gyro-center model for runaway electrons. As a result, the energy limit of runaway electrons is found to be larger than the prediction of the gyro-center model and to depend heavily on the background magnetic field.
